product_name: MILK MAKEUPHydro Grip Hydrating Makeup Primer with Hyaluronic Acid + Niacinamide
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganGive BackMilk Makeup's 13x award-winning Hydro Grip Primer is a 12-hour gel makeup primer that hydrates with hyaluronic acid and niacinamide for a dewy finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsFirst-of-its-kind grippy gel primerClinically proven to grip makeup up to 12 hoursHydrates skin for a dewy finishPrevents makeup from fading and patchinessHelps makeup go on smooth and last all dayGoes on clear, so it works for all skin types + skin tonesFormulated with 7 skincare superstarsNon-comedogenic, so it won't clog poresSilicone-free, so there's no heavy or greasy feel96% naturalKey IngredientsBlue agave extract grips makeup up to 12 hours to prevent melting, fading, and cakingHyaluronic acid and niacinamide (vitamin B3) boost hydration to visibly smooth uneven textureAloe water + hemp seed extract provide an additional boost of hydration to lock in moistureFormulated WithoutParabensSiliconeOilFragranceGlutenItem 2634881How To UseApply one to two pumps of primer onto the back of your hand.Blend a thin layer onto clean skin before makeup application.Let the formula set for 60 seconds to absorb and activate grip for all-day hold.Layer foundation and other makeup on top for a smooth application that lasts all day or wear alone for a dewy glow.End your routine with Hydro Grip Set + Refresh Spray (sold separately) for extra long-lasting makeup.Pro Tip: To prevent pilling, let skincare and sunscreen fully absorb before primer application. Start with one pump and add more if needed.IngredientsAloe Barbadensis Leaf Water, Water/Aqua/Eau, Glycerin, Alcohol Denat., PEG-150 Distearate, Polyglyceryl-10 Eicosanedioate/Tetradecanedioate, Diglycerin, Cannabis Sativa (Hemp) Seed Extract, Opuntia Ficus-Indica Flower Extract, Prunus Avium (Sweet Cherry) Flower Extract, Agave Tequilana Leaf Extract, Sodium Hyaluronate, Niacinamide, Sorbitol, Pullulan, Inositol, Betaine, Carbomer, Maltose, Xylitol, Sodium Hydroxide, PVP, Propylene Glycol, Panthenol, Vegetable Amino Acids, Sodium Phytate, Citric Acid, Alcohol, Benzoic Acid, Sodium Benzoate, Dehydroacetic Acid, Benzyl Alcohol, Potassium Sorbate, Phenoxyethanol.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Apply one to two pumps of primer onto the back of your hand.Blend a thin layer onto clean skin before makeup application.Let the formula set for 60 seconds to absorb and activate grip for all-day hold.Layer foundation and other makeup on top for a smooth application that lasts all day or wear alone for a dewy glow.End your routine with Hydro Grip Set + Refresh Spray (sold separately) for extra long-lasting makeup.Pro Tip: To prevent pilling, let skincare and sunscreen fully absorb before primer application. Start with one pump and add more if needed.

reviews.headline: Makeup looked worse under this.
reviews.comments: Foundation slide off and had a horrible smell to it. Returned it

reviews.headline: Staple
reviews.comments: This is a staple product for me to use when applying on makeup must have.

reviews.headline: Never purchase!!
reviews.comments: Worst primer I've ever tried. It made my makeup pill so bad throughout my makeup routine. Makes makeup look muddy!!!! Worst primer ever. It's not smooth at all and does not make makeup look flawless. Do not purchase!

reviews.headline: yuck
reviews.comments: my makeup immediately started separating with this primer, and as soon as I had any sweat, it was GONE. not impressed at all.

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: I'd heard amazing things about this and really wanted to like it. Unfortunately my makeup immediately started flaking off. I tried it multiple ways and it still did it. Also noticed a slight burning around my eyes which has never happened with my other products

reviews.headline: Not for me
reviews.comments: While many rave about this product, I found it was not for me.  It doesn't sit well under my makeup.  My foundation would ball up when I applied it over this primer.

reviews.headline: The Best!
reviews.comments: This is hands down the best primer I have ever used. Make sure you give it some time  to dry before applying your makeup.

reviews.headline: Truly grips
reviews.comments:
I've been really impressed by this primer so far! I have an oily T zone, and live in an area that can get hot and humid, and work 12 hr shifts. All that translates into an essentially neverending search for products that look good, feel good, and hold up to the harsh conditions. ðŸ˜‚  

This is one of two primers I've ever tried that noticeably extend the wear time of my makeup (and that other primer is no longer produced, of course). Not sure what's up with some of the reviews commenting on a horrific smell (maybe an odd bad batch, or expired product?), but to me, the product has no scent at all. Imediately upon application, the product feels moisturizing, but with spreading/rubbing it, it turns tacky-feeling. Hence the "Hydro Grip" name.

I will say that the tackiness is not a pleasant sensation for me, but knowing it serves a purpose helps (plus, it really isn't noticeable after makeup is applied). Personally, I like the velvet feel and blurring effect of primers with a creamy whipped texture. Expecting a pilling disaster, I tried mixing the Iconic London Velvet Smooth primer with the Milk Hydro Grip primer - and was pleasantly shocked that I got my Goldilocks "just right" primer. Hydrating, pore blurring, and makeup gripping.

reviews.headline: Images
reviews.comments: The product is way smaller than the picture. Product is not that good for the price

reviews.headline: Can't get past the smell
reviews.comments: The product does the job, but it smells like horse and fish mixed together. If it smelled different I would give it 5 stars.

reviews.headline: Works for me!
reviews.comments: Based on other reviews, this may not work for everybody, but it is my favorite primer! I have mainly oily skin, some dryness here and there, and this primer keeps my makeup lasting all day! I don't have ance-prone or sensitive skin so I can't speak to that, but if you don't either this could work for you.

reviews.headline: I would definitely buy this primer again.
reviews.comments: It blurs skin and grips makeup.

reviews.headline: It smells?
reviews.comments: I don't know if anyone else has had this problem but mine smells awful. It smells like a lady's privates if she was sick and nasty? When I first put this on I freaked out because I thought something was wrong with my body. Nope just the product.

reviews.headline: good
reviews.comments: Once I saw Ulta had this available I was super excited to try it out! It works great and makes your makeup hold up good, but if you have acne prone skin I would suggest staying away from this and finding a primer made for acne prone skin.  I started using this and began to breakout, more than usual and I can say the only thing that has changed is which primer I was using so this was the culprit... I have discontinued use and went back to my old primer and my skin is clearing up.  It's a good primer just not the best for those who's skin is prone to acne in my opinion.

reviews.headline: Mid
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this, but am pretty disappointed. I like the feel, and it does seem to be hydrating, but i am finding that by the afternoon, if I touch my face, my makeup rolls off in spots. It never did that before using the Milk Primer and the hydro grip set and refresh makeup setting spray. I also wish Ulta would allow people to see 1 and 2 star reviews. Hiding them doesn't give people a clear view into what might be common problems.

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: Just no. Dont buy this, the elf one is better.

reviews.headline: Game changer
reviews.comments:
I received a sample size of this as a gift for buying other Milk products, but I'm definitely buying the full size. 
I never liked using primers bc they make my skin feel weird â€¦ but this is just differentâ€¦ 
Feels like a gel creme, and definitely helped the rest of my makeup stay on alll day!

reviews.headline: Amazing!!
reviews.comments: Best primer I've used!! I have combination skin, the formula is hydrating but not overly heavy.  And doesn't leave my skin feeling stick or greasy.

reviews.headline: I need it in the winter
reviews.comments: My skin looks so dull and dead in winter so I love this for bringing me back to life and giving me that kind of sunny look that feels like summertime. To me the scent is subtle but I really like that too. Honestly it's such a must have when it's cold and dry out or if you're in a dry place

reviews.headline: This works!
reviews.comments: This actually keeps my makeup looking fresh all day! Very little rub off throughout the day.  I put it on and let it dry a few minutes before applying makeup.

faceoff_positive.comments: I received this primer complimentary for review purposes. This does not affect my thoughts or experience with this product. I got a sample size of the milk hydro grip primer to try and I was really excited because I love milk makeup and there's a lot of hype around this primer. Its very light weight and absorbs into the skin quickly. It does leave behind a tacky feeling which helps to grip your makeup and hold it in place. I did notice that it doesnt play very well with the tatcha silk canvas primer. I like to use a pore filling primer in my t zone and when the two of these mixed they started to pill but it wasn't super bad and I was still able to use them together. It just took a little extra work. It does feel hydrating and it definitely grips makeup. I wore a full face glam all day and my base did not budge which is a fiat for me. I have an oily t zone and usually after a couple hours my makeup is slipping and sliding but not with this primer underneath. I do want to find a way to use a pore primer with it. But it's ok. Ive tried it with a coupe different foundations powders and concealer and I had the same results each time. This is a great gripping primer! When I use this I know that I can trust my base makeup. I really enjoyed this
faceoff_positive.headline: Nice gripping primer

faceoff_negative.comments: I received a sample of this, so I wanted to try it today. I will say that I am unimpressed. I have oily/normal skin with a touch of rosacea, and I use a variety of powder makeup. Today I am in Bare Minerals, which typically works fine with most of my primers. This, however, I do not like. It's been hours since I did my makeup this morning, and I still feel it on my skin. The way my skin feels, I want to wash it all off and start over with a different primer. I don't find it to be hydrating in the least, my face just feels like it needs to be cleaned. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this to anyone I know.
faceoff_negative.headline: Did Not Work For Me

rollup.name: Hydro Grip Hydrating Makeup Primer with Hyaluronic Acid + Niacinamide
